title: Update CI workflow for Codecov
description: Enhance CI workflow to upload coverage with fail_on_error and verbose logging

title: Create CI quality workflow
description:
Create .github/workflows/ci.yml for continuous integration with test, lint, and format jobs.

WHY: Provide automated feedback to contributors within 5 minutes and ensure code quality.

WHAT: Create CI workflow with test, lint, and format checks using GitHub Actions.

title: Phase 2: US1 - License Compliance
description:
Open Source License Compliance (P1)

Ensure project has proper open source licensing and legal documentation.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Without proper licensing, the project cannot be effectively open-sourced or used by others, creating legal risk and limiting community adoption.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Review presence and completeness of required legal files (LICENSE, NOTICE, etc.) and verify they contain appropriate content.

Creates:
- NOTICE file for third-party attributions
- GOVERNANCE.md for project decision-making
- Verification of existing legal files (LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, SECURITY, CONTRIBUTING)

title: Phase 3: US4 - Release and Distribution
description:
Release and Distribution (P1)

Easy installation and updates using standard package managers.

WHY THIS PRIORITY: Easy installation through package managers significantly lowers the barrier to adoption and ensures users can quickly get updates.

INDEPENDENT TEST: Install the project using Homebrew and verify installation works correctly.

Creates:
- Update GoReleaser configuration verification
- Verify Homebrew tap functionality
- Test release process with dry-run

title: Phase 1: Setup and Infrastructure
description:
Shared infrastructure setup for all open source readiness work.

Creates:
- golangci-lint configuration (.golangci.yml)
- CI quality workflow (.github/workflows/ci.yml)
- Go version update (1.21 â†’ 1.24)
- Codecov setup

These tasks block all user stories as they establish the quality infrastructure.

title: Test GitHub Actions release workflow
description: Push test tag and verify GitHub Actions builds and publishes all artifacts

title: Foundational: Add Version Flag to CLI
description: Add --version flag that displays version information embedded via GoReleaser ldflags

title: Add --artifact-path flag for manual specification
description: Add --artifact-path flag for manually specifying artifact path when adding non-SpecLedger repository dependencies.

title: US5: Release Automation
description: Pushing git tag automatically builds and publishes all release artifacts

title: US2: Shell Script Installation
description: Install tool with single curl command - detects architecture (Intel/Apple Silicon), verifies checksums

title: Remove beads setup from init.sh
description: Remove the beads setup call from the post-init script so sl init no longer attempts to initialize Beads.
design: File: pkg/embedded/templates/specledger/init.sh\nRemove or comment out the call to setup-beads.sh.\nUpdate script to not require beads for successful initialization.
acceptance_criteria: - init.sh no longer calls setup-beads.sh\n- sl init completes without beads installed

title: Define Issue entity and types
description: Create the core Issue struct and related types (IssueStatus, IssueType) in pkg/issues/issue.go. This is the foundational data structure for all issue operations.
design:
File: pkg/issues/issue.go
Define:
- type IssueStatus string (open, in_progress, closed)
- type IssueType string (epic, feature, task, bug)
- type Issue struct with all fields per data-model.md
- Validation methods for Issue fields

Follow existing patterns from pkg/cli/models/ if applicable.
acceptance_criteria:
- Issue struct defined with all required fields
- Type constants defined
- Validation methods work correctly
- Unit tests pass in tests/issues/issue_test.go

title: Create NOTICE file
description:
Create NOTICE file at repository root for third-party attributions.

WHY: Transparency about third-party dependencies is best practice for open source projects, even when attribution is not legally required.

WHAT: Create NOTICE file listing all third-party dependencies with their licenses and source URLs.

title: Implement auto-download in sl deps add
description: After adding dependency to metadata, automatically clone the repository to ~/.specledger/cache/<alias>/. Use go-git/v5 PlainClone for Git operations.

title: Add codecov.yml configuration
description: Create codecov.yml with 70% coverage target (informational), ignore patterns for tests/mocks/generated code, and GitHub annotations for PR comments

title: Create GOVERNANCE.md
description:
Create GOVERNANCE.md documenting project decision-making process and maintainer structure.

WHY: Governance information builds trust in the project's longevity and helps contributors understand how decisions are made.

WHAT: Create GOVERNANCE.md at repository root with project leadership, decision-making process, release process, and security policy references.

title: Make --alias flag required for sl deps add
description: Update sl deps add command to require the --alias flag instead of treating it as optional. Error: 'alias is required (use --alias <name>)'

title: Add external dependencies to go.mod
description: Add required external dependencies for the issue tracking system: gofrs/flock for file locking, texttheater/golang-levenshtein for string similarity.
design:
Add to go.mod:
- github.com/gofrs/flock v0.12.1
- github.com/texttheater/golang-levenshtein v1.0.1
Run go mod tidy to resolve versions.
acceptance_criteria: - Dependencies added to go.mod\n- go mod tidy runs successfully\n- Dependencies download without errors

title: Create artifact path detection functions
description: Create pkg/deps/resolver.go with DetectArtifactPathFromSpecLedgerRepo() function to read specledger.yaml and return artifact_path value.

title: Add ArtifactPath field to ProjectMetadata
description: Add ArtifactPath field to pkg/cli/metadata/schema.go ProjectMetadata struct to specify where current project's artifacts are located

title: Create tests/issues directory structure
description: Create the test directory structure for issue tracking unit and integration tests.
design: Create directories:\n- tests/issues/ for unit tests\n- tests/integration/ for CLI integration tests
acceptance_criteria: - tests/issues/ directory exists\n- tests/integration/ directory exists

title: Add golangci-lint configuration
description:
Create .golangci.yml configuration file with standard Go linters (gofmt, govet, staticcheck, errcheck, gosimple, ineffassign, unused, gosec).

WHY: Establish consistent code quality standards across the project.

WHAT: Create .golangci.yml at repository root with enabled linters and appropriate settings.

title: Implement SHA-256 ID generation
description: Create the ID generation logic in pkg/issues/id.go. Generate deterministic, collision-resistant IDs in format SL-<6-char-hex> from SHA-256 hash of (spec_context + title + created_at).
design:
File: pkg/issues/id.go
Functions:
- GenerateIssueID(specContext, title string, createdAt time.Time) string
- ParseIssueID(id string) error

Use crypto/sha256 from standard library. First 3 bytes (6 hex chars) of hash.
acceptance_criteria:
- IDs follow format SL-xxxxxx
- Same inputs produce same ID (deterministic)
- Different inputs produce different IDs
- ParseIssueID validates format correctly
- Unit tests pass in tests/issues/id_test.go

title: Fix install script architecture detection
description: Add arm64 detection for Apple Silicon, fix binary extraction path, add checksum verification

title: Implement JSONL file store operations
description: Create the Store struct in pkg/issues/store.go with JSONL file operations (read, write, append) and file locking for concurrent access.
design:
File: pkg/issues/store.go
Functions:
- NewStore(specContext string) (*Store, error)
- Create(issue *Issue) error
- Get(id string) (*Issue, error)
- List(filter ListFilter) ([]Issue, error)
- Update(id string, updates IssueUpdate) error
- Delete(id string) error
- WithLock(fn func() error) error

Use gofrs/flock for file locking. Store path: specledger/<spec>/issues.jsonl
acceptance_criteria:
- Store can read/write JSONL files
- File locking prevents concurrent write corruption
- ListFilter works for status, type, priority filters
- Unit tests pass in tests/issues/store_test.go

title: Remove bd and perles from CoreTools
description: Remove Beads (bd) and Perles from the required CoreTools list in the prerequisites checker.
design:
File: pkg/cli/prerequisites/checker.go
Remove bd and perles entries from CoreTools slice.
Keep mise as the only required core tool.
Update related functions if needed.
acceptance_criteria: - pkg/cli/prerequisites/checker.go no longer lists bd or perles\n- CoreTools only contains mise\n- Go compilation succeeds

title: Integrate auto-discovery into sl deps add
description: After cloning dependency, attempt to read its specledger.yaml to auto-discover artifact_path for SpecLedger repos.

title: Create pkg/issues directory structure
description: Create the new pkg/issues package directory structure for the issue tracking system. This establishes the foundational location for all issue-related code.
design: Create directory: pkg/issues/. Follow Go package conventions with separate files for each concern (issue.go, store.go, id.go, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: - pkg/issues/ directory exists\n- Go package initialization ready\n- No compilation errors

title: US1: Binary Download from GitHub Releases
description: Users can download pre-built macOS binaries (amd64, arm64) from GitHub Releases

title: Simplify GoReleaser builds to macOS only
description: Update .goreleaser.yaml to build only darwin_amd64 and darwin_arm64, remove Linux/Windows builds temporarily

title: Add version variable to main.go
description: Add version variables in main.go to be populated by GoReleaser ldflags

title: Implement spec context detection
description: Create utility function to detect current spec context from git branch name (###-short-name pattern) and handle error when no context detected.
design:
File: pkg/issues/context.go
Functions:
- DetectSpecContext() (string, error) - uses go-git to get current branch
- ParseSpecFromBranch(branchName string) (string, bool)

Error message: 'Not on a feature branch. Use --spec flag or checkout a ###-branch.'
acceptance_criteria: - Detects spec from ###-branch-name pattern\n- Returns error when not on feature branch\n- Works with various branch naming conventions

title: Implement sl issue create command
description: Create the 'sl issue create' subcommand in pkg/cli/commands/issue.go. This command creates new issues with the specified fields and stores them in the appropriate issues.jsonl file.
design:
File: pkg/cli/commands/issue.go
Flags: --title (required), --description, --type, --priority, --force, --spec
Use Cobra command pattern following existing commands.
Call pkg/issues/store.go for storage.
Output: Created issue ID and summary.
acceptance_criteria:
- 'sl issue create --title "Test"' creates issue with SL-xxxxxx ID
- Issue stored in correct issues.jsonl file
- --spec flag allows overriding spec context
- Error when not on feature branch without --spec
- Command follows existing CLI patterns
